examInfo.title: प्रदेश लोक सेवा आयोग, कर्णाली प्रदेश
examInfo.subtitle: इन्जिनियरिंग सेवा, सिभिल समूह, जनरल, हाइवे, स्यानिटरी, ईग्रेसेन उपसमूह अधिकृत सातौं तहको खुला समावेशी र अन्दर सेवा प्रतियोगितात्मक लिखित परीक्षा
examInfo.subject: Objective MCQs - Civil Engineering

instructions: कुनै पनि प्रश्नमा गलत उत्तरको लागि काट्ने प्रक्रिया छैन
समय सकिएपछि परीक्षा स्वतः जम्मा हुनेछ

questions.question: What is the standard size of a modular brick?
questions.explanation: As per IS 1077:1992, the standard size of modular brick is 190 mm × 90 mm × 90 mm.

questions.question: The process of improving load bearing capacity of soil is called:
questions.explanation: Soil stabilization is the process of improving the engineering properties of soil to increase its bearing capacity.

questions.question: What is the minimum grade of concrete recommended for RCC works as per IS 456?
questions.explanation: As per IS 456:2000, the minimum grade of concrete for RCC works is M20.

questions.question: The ratio of the volume of voids to the total volume of soil mass is called:
questions.explanation: Porosity (n) = Volume of voids / Total volume.

questions.question: The instrument used for measuring angles in surveying is:
questions.explanation: Theodolite is used for measuring horizontal and vertical angles in surveying.

questions.question: The maximum permissible deflection for a cantilever beam of length L is:
questions.explanation: As per IS 456:2000, maximum deflection for cantilever = L/250.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a method of concrete mixing?
questions.explanation: Dry mixing is not a standard method for concrete mixing.

questions.question: The minimum number of longitudinal bars in a circular column should be:
questions.explanation: As per IS 456:2000, minimum 6 bars for circular columns.

questions.question: The property of fresh concrete which determines its ability to flow is called:
questions.explanation: Workability is the ease with which concrete can be mixed, placed, and compacted.

questions.question: The most commonly used admixture in concrete to retard setting time is:
questions.explanation: Gypsum is added to cement to retard the setting time.

questions.question: What is the standard size of A4 drawing sheet?
questions.explanation: A4 size drawing sheet dimensions are 210 mm × 297 mm.

questions.question: The longitudinal slope of a road in the direction of movement is called:
questions.explanation: Gradient is the longitudinal slope along the length of the road.

questions.question: The unit of measurement for steel reinforcement in RCC is:
questions.explanation: Steel reinforcement is measured in kilograms as per IS 1200.

questions.question: The type of foundation suitable for expansive soils is:
questions.explanation: Under-reamed piles are suitable for expansive soils to resist uplift forces.

questions.question: Which instrument is used to measure the workability of concrete?
questions.explanation: Slump test using slump cone is the most common method to measure workability.

questions.question: The process of removing air from the concrete is called:
questions.explanation: Compaction removes entrapped air from fresh concrete.

questions.question: The minimum cover for reinforcement in slab is:
questions.explanation: As per IS 456:2000, minimum cover for slab is 20 mm.

questions.question: The distance between two successive contours is called:
questions.explanation: Contour interval is the vertical distance between two successive contours.

questions.question: Which of the following is a non-destructive test for concrete?
questions.explanation: UPV test is non-destructive, others are destructive tests.

questions.question: The steel bars used in prestressed concrete are:
questions.explanation: High tensile steel wires are used in prestressed concrete.

questions.question: The most common type of retaining wall for heights up to 6m is:
questions.explanation: Cantilever retaining walls are economical for heights up to 6m.

questions.question: The instrument used to measure the consistency of cement is:
questions.explanation: Vicat apparatus is used to determine the consistency and setting time of cement.

questions.question: The minimum curing period for ordinary Portland cement concrete is:
questions.explanation: Minimum curing period for OPC concrete is 7 days as per IS 456.

questions.question: The most common type of lintel used in building construction is:
questions.explanation: RCC lintels are most commonly used due to their strength and durability.

questions.question: The ratio of stress to strain within elastic limit is called:
questions.explanation: Modulus of elasticity = Stress/Strain (within elastic limit).

questions.question: Which of the following is a flexible pavement?
questions.explanation: Bituminous pavements are flexible, concrete pavements are rigid.

questions.question: The permissible limit for chloride content in concrete for RCC works is:
questions.explanation: As per IS 456, maximum chloride content in RCC is 0.1% by weight of cement.

questions.question: The type of pile which transfers load mainly by skin friction is called:
questions.explanation: Friction piles transfer load through skin friction along the pile shaft.

questions.question: The minimum width of staircase for residential buildings is:
questions.explanation: As per National Building Code, minimum width for residential staircase is 0.9 m.

questions.question: The process of making the surface of concrete rough to improve bonding is called:
questions.explanation: Hacking is the process of making the concrete surface rough for better bonding.

questions.question: The minimum number of days for removal of formwork for slab is:
questions.explanation: For slab, formwork can be removed after 7 days for OPC concrete.

questions.question: Which of the following is a surface water source?
questions.explanation: River is a surface water source, others are groundwater sources.

questions.question: The minimum thickness of slab for residential buildings is:
questions.explanation: Minimum slab thickness for residential buildings is 100 mm as per IS 456.

questions.question: The instrument used to measure the workability of very dry concrete is:
questions.explanation: Compaction factor test is suitable for very dry concrete mixes.

questions.question: The ratio of lateral strain to longitudinal strain is called:
questions.explanation: Poisson's ratio = Lateral strain / Longitudinal strain.

questions.question: The most common type of foundation for isolated columns is:
questions.explanation: Spread footing is the most common foundation for isolated columns.

questions.question: The minimum diameter of longitudinal bar in column is:
questions.explanation: Minimum diameter of longitudinal bar in column is 12 mm as per IS 456.

questions.question: The process of mixing and transporting concrete by a single machine is called:
questions.explanation: Transit mix concrete is mixed in a truck mixer during transportation.

questions.question: The minimum compressive strength of brick as per IS 1077 is:
questions.explanation: Minimum compressive strength of common burnt clay brick is 3.5 N/mm².

questions.question: The type of beam which has reinforcement only in tension zone is:
questions.explanation: Singly reinforced beam has steel only in tension zone.

questions.question: The permissible settlement for isolated foundation on clay is:
questions.explanation: Permissible settlement for isolated foundation on clay is 65 mm as per IS 1904.

questions.question: The most common type of stair used in residential buildings is:
questions.explanation: Dog-legged stair is most common due to space efficiency.

questions.question: The minimum cement content for M20 grade concrete exposed to severe conditions is:
questions.explanation: Minimum cement content for M20 concrete in severe exposure is 320 kg/m³ (IS 456).

questions.question: The type of bond used in brick masonry where headers and stretchers alternate is:
questions.explanation: In Flemish bond, headers and stretchers alternate in each course.

questions.question: The maximum spacing of main reinforcement in slab should not exceed:
questions.explanation: Maximum spacing = 3d or 300 mm, whichever is less (IS 456).

questions.question: The instrument used to measure the bearing of a line is:
questions.explanation: All these instruments can be used to measure bearings.

questions.question: The minimum edge distance for bolts in steel structures is:
questions.explanation: Minimum edge distance = 1.5d for rolled edges (IS 800).

questions.question: The type of cement suitable for mass concrete works is:
questions.explanation: Low heat cement generates less heat during hydration, suitable for mass concrete.

questions.question: The process of converting a liquid into a solid mass is called:
questions.explanation: Setting is the process of changing from liquid to solid state.

questions.question: The maximum water-cement ratio for M25 grade concrete is:
questions.explanation: Maximum w/c ratio for M25 concrete is 0.50 as per IS 456.

questions.question: The type of foundation suitable for black cotton soil is:
questions.explanation: Raft foundation distributes load over large area, suitable for expansive soils.

questions.question: The minimum thickness of one-way slab simply supported is:
questions.explanation: Minimum thickness for simply supported slab = L/20 (IS 456).

questions.question: The instrument used to measure the workability of self-compacting concrete is:
questions.explanation: All these tests are used for self-compacting concrete.

questions.question: The type of bond where all bricks are laid as stretchers is:
questions.explanation: In stretcher bond, all bricks are laid as stretchers.

questions.question: The minimum number of samples for concrete testing per 100 m³ is:
questions.explanation: Minimum 6 samples per 100 m³ of concrete as per IS 456.

questions.question: The type of pile which is driven and then the soil inside is removed is called:
questions.explanation: Bored piles are installed by drilling and removing soil.

questions.question: The maximum spacing of stirrups in beam should not exceed:
questions.explanation: Maximum spacing = 0.75d or 300 mm, whichever is less (IS 456).

questions.question: The instrument used to determine the particle size distribution of soil is:
questions.explanation: Sieve for coarse particles, hydrometer for fine particles.

questions.question: The type of cement suitable for underwater construction is:
questions.explanation: Quick setting cement sets quickly, suitable for underwater works.

questions.question: The minimum width of tread in staircase for residential building is:
questions.explanation: Minimum tread width for residential staircase is 250 mm.

questions.question: The maximum size of aggregate for reinforced concrete is:
questions.explanation: Maximum aggregate size for RCC is 20 mm generally.

questions.question: The type of paint suitable for exterior walls is:
questions.explanation: All these paints can be used for exterior walls.

questions.question: The minimum diameter of bar used in slab is:
questions.explanation: Minimum diameter of bar in slab is 8 mm as per IS 456.

questions.question: The instrument used to measure the consistency of cement paste is:
questions.explanation: Vicat apparatus measures consistency, initial and final setting time.

questions.question: The type of foundation suitable for transmitting load through soft soil to hard stratum is:
questions.explanation: Pile foundation transfers load through soft soil to hard stratum.

questions.question: The minimum rise in staircase for public buildings is:
questions.explanation: Minimum rise for public buildings is 150 mm.

questions.question: The type of beam supported at both ends is called:
questions.explanation: Simply supported beam has supports at both ends.

questions.question: The maximum water-cement ratio for M40 grade concrete is:
questions.explanation: Maximum w/c ratio for M40 concrete is 0.45 as per IS 456.

questions.question: The instrument used to measure the workability of cement mortar is:
questions.explanation: Flow table test measures workability of cement mortar.

questions.question: The type of cement used for construction in sulphate-rich environment is:
questions.explanation: Sulphate resisting cement is used in sulphate-rich environments.
